private_information: Permitted disks: A, B, C, D, E
You can move only one disk at a time
You must never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Contribute legal moves for disks A, B, C, D, E to achieve the goal configuration while coordinating with the other agents.

private_information: Permitted disks: F, G, H, I, J
You can move only one disk at a time
You must never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Contribute legal moves for disks F, G, H, I, J when required, coordinating with the other agents to reach the goal configuration.

private_information: Permitted disks: K, L, M, N, O
You can move only one disk at a time
You must never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
agent_3.goal: Contribute legal moves for disks K, L, M, N, O when required, coordinating with the other agents to reach the goal configuration.

private_information: Role: Audit temporal and causal consistency of proposed move sequences
Detect and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, timers, or non-physical abstractions
Verify adherence to Tower of Hanoi legality and agent-permission constraints
auditor.goal: Ensure the integrated move sequence is temporally and causally consistent, free of bookkeeping shortcuts, and respects all rules and agent permissions.

private_information: Integrate agent plans, resolve conflicts, and output the final ordered move list
Produce the final PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver, encapsulated in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags
orchestrator.goal: Coordinate all agents to achieve the specified goal configuration. Output the final ordered list of primitive moves and the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: Initial: left has A..O from top to bottom; middle empty; right empty.
Goal: left has B,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O (top to bottom); middle has A,D (top to bottom); right has C.
Rules: move exactly one disk at a time; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk; only the top disk of a peg may be moved.
Agent permissions: agent_1 moves A,B,C,D,E; agent_2 moves F,G,H,I,J; agent_3 moves K,L,M,N,O.
Required move format: agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2.

ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk B from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk D from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk B from right to left
notes: After move 7, right peg holds A,B,C; left peg top is D; middle empty.
Move 9 places A on top of D at middle.
Move 10 places B on top of E at left, leaving C alone on right. Goal achieved.

plan.system_prompt: You plan legal Tower of Hanoi moves for disks A, B, C, D, E only. Respect all rules and only move the topmost disk of any peg.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Use the public information to propose a minimal, legal sequence of primitive moves for disks A, B, C, D, E that helps achieve the goal configuration. Use the exact move format: agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. Do not generate PDDL.

plan.system_prompt: You plan legal Tower of Hanoi moves for disks F, G, H, I, J only. If no moves are necessary, output an explicit no-op rationale.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Use the public information to determine whether any moves of disks F, G, H, I, J are required. If not, provide a concise explanation. Use the exact move format if moves are needed. Do not generate PDDL.

plan.system_prompt: You plan legal Tower of Hanoi moves for disks K, L, M, N, O only. If no moves are necessary, output an explicit no-op rationale.
plan.prompt: Your name is agent_3. Use the public information to determine whether any moves of disks K, L, M, N, O are required. If not, provide a concise explanation. Use the exact move format if moves are needed. Do not generate PDDL.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency. Verify that every move is legal, respects agent permissions, and preserves Tower of Hanoi invariants. Remove bookkeeping shortcuts (quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, timers, or non-physical abstractions).
audit.prompt: Review the candidate plans. Confirm that moves are feasible from the initial state toward the goal, that no larger disk is ever placed on a smaller one, and that only authorized agents move their allowed disks. Provide a cleaned, causally consistent ordered list of moves and a brief justification.

plan_moves.system_prompt: You integrate plans into a single, conflict-free, legally ordered move list that reaches the goal configuration.
plan_moves.prompt: Integrate inputs to produce the final ordered list of primitive moves in the required format agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2. Ensure all moves obey the Tower of Hanoi rules and agent permissions. If the auditor proposes revisions, adopt them unless inconsistent with the public information.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL for FastDownwards. Produce a complete domain and problem for this 3-peg, 15-disk, multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance. Keep agent actions distinct where relevant. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
pddl.prompt: Generate a PDDL domain and problem that encode the public information, agent move capabilities, legality constraints (one disk at a time, no larger on smaller), the initial configuration, and the goal configuration. Target the FastDownwards solver and ensure compatibility.
